name: "Magnum, P.I." Season Four DVD Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Was T.C.'s sister killed while in Magnum's care in the episode "Distant Relative"?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Rick's sister Wendy Wright had come to Hawaii to spend time with Rick. What Rick didn't know was that Wendy was a party girl and a drug mule. She was murdered after seeing two federal agents killed execution style. At the time, she was supposed to be with Magnum watching "Bambi" at the movie theater.

questions.text: Carol Burnett guest starred on "Magnum, P.I." as the assistant manager of a bank. What was the title of the episode she guest starred in?
questions.explanation:
Rembrandt's Girl.

	Susan Johnson (Carol Burnett) and Magnum spent most of the episode locked in a bank vault after she short circuited the control panel. Susan wanted Magnum to investigate her father believing he was laundering money through her bank, however, it turned out that her father was not the man laundering money through her bank. The real culprit was her fiancé. Susan's father was wanting her to accompany him on a trip around the world to sketch famous landmarks for a set of dishes he was going to market.  Donald Bellisario's wife at the time, Deborah Pratt, and Tom Selleck's present wife, Jillie Mack, starred respectively in this episode as T.C.'s girlfriend and a party girl that comes to T.C. and Rick's guest house party.

questions.text: In "Dream a Little Dream," when Magnum became a private investigator, how did he advertise?
questions.explanation:
Match books.

	In "Dream a Little Dream", Magnum went back to 1979 after he met his first client again to help her in another threat against her life. Back in 1979, Magnum was seen with longer hair and driving a blue Volkswagen. His first case also led him to use Rick for the first time to run down a license plate and T.C. flew Magnum for the first time.

questions.text: While stranded at sea in "Home From Sea", what name did Magnum give the shark that circled him?
questions.explanation:
Herman.

	One of Magnum's Fourth of July traditions was to spend the day by himself since that was the day his father was buried. While stranded at sea, Magnum thought a lot about the last time he saw his father. During their last trip together as a family, Magnum had told his father about the monster that lived in his room. Magnum's father told him that if he named the monster if wouldn't be so scary so they called the monster Herman. Magnum gave the shark the same name as the monster that lived in his room as a child.

questions.text: What book was the theme of the party Higgins was throwing in the episode, "The Case of the Red Faced Thespian"?
questions.explanation:
The Great Gatsby.

	Higgins hosted a party in the theme of "The Great Gatsby". During the party, Magnum tried to find a killer so neither Rick nor Higgins would be blamed for a murder that took place in Higgins bedroom.

questions.text: The three men that robbed the King Kamehameha Club in the fourth season finale "I Witness" wore masks that looked like a rabbit, a pig, and what other animal?
questions.explanation:
Gorilla.

	Magnum had just started to watch a baseball game that aired in the early Hawaiian hours when the game was interrupted by a news broadcast at Rick's club. Magnum rushed down to the club to learn that three men wearing a rabbit, pig, and gorilla mask robbed the club. By listening to the stories from Rick, T.C., and Higgins, Magnum was able to piece together the real criminal in the theft.

questions.text: What was the name of Robin Masters softball team in "Squeeze Play"?
questions.explanation:
Paddlers.

	When Robin lost a game of poker with Buzz Benoit, he bet his baseball team against Buzz's baseball team. If Robin's team lost, Buzz got to live at Robin's Nest for one year. This deal was all right with Magnum until he learned he would have to move out of the guest house if Buzz won the baseball game.

questions.text: What Christmas song completes the "Magnum, P.I." Christmas show titled, "Operation: ___________"?
questions.explanation:
Silent Night.

	In "Operation: Silent Night", Magnum, Higgins, T.C., and Rick were stranded on a island designated as a Navy fire zone when T.C.'s chopper broke down. With the threat of death, T.C. got the helicopter fixed in time to fly off the island before a missile hit the exact spot where the helicopter had broken down. As the guys flew into the night, they all sang "Silent Night".   Larry Manetti, who plays Orville "Rick" Wright, had stated that this episode was his favorite of the series.

questions.text: Which famous young actress played Ima on the episode, "A Sense of Debt"?
questions.explanation:
Shannon Doherty.

	Shannon Doherty starred as Ima Platt, the daughter of boxer Leon Platt. While using Magnum's Ferrari while he was on business, T.C. injured Leon Platt in an accident. To repay him for his part in the accident, T.C. took Leon's place in the boxing ring. When Leon's daughter, Ima, was kidnapped Higgins called Magnum back from his business trip to help save Ima and Leon.  Alan Trammell and Lou Whitaker of the Detroit Tigers appeared as themselves in a Detroit bar to buy Magnum a drink and give him a free ticket to the baseball game.

questions.text: Higgins cast parts at Robin's Nest for what musical he was putting on for charity in "Let the Punishment Fit the Crime"?
questions.explanation:
The Mikado.

	Higgins cast parts in "Let the Punishment Fit the Crime" for the musical Mikado. When two of the women that were going to play geisha's bowed out at the last minute, Rick and T.C. took their place to star alongside Agatha. Meanwhile, Magnum realized that his client, Sally Deforest, was out to kill a visiting castmate of the performance and he had invited her to stay at Robin's Nest for her protection.  The title of the episode came from the Gilbert and Sullivan play, "The Mikado".
